channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump’s flip-flopping on early voting isn’t the only reason Republicans are flocking to the polls, election expert says
item.description: More working-class voters, who have historically preferred early voting, are turning red.

item.title: Lucy Letby, Former U.K. Nurse, Tries to Appeal One Conviction for Attempted Murder
item.description: Ms. Letby is serving 15 life sentences after the deaths and collapses of babies in the neonatal unit where she worked. On Thursday judges will conside...

item.title: North Carolina says it needs at least $53 billion to recover from Hurricane Helene damages
item.description: Gov. Roy Cooper said the state's previous record for storm damage was $17 billion from Hurricane Florence, which struck eastern North Carolina in 2018...

item.title: Cambodia Journalist Who Exposed Scams Is Released on Bail
item.description: Mech Dara spent three weeks in detention after he was charged for posts he made online. He still faces a charge of “incitement to provoke social chaos...

item.title: E.P.A. Toughens Requirements to Remove Lead Paint Dust Around Children
item.description: The new rules consider any detectable level of lead dust in a building a “lead hazard,” requiring property owners to pay for cleanup.

item.title: Elon Musk, R.F.K. Jr. and the Unconfirmables of a Second Trump Administration
item.description: Back in the White House, Trump would get input from a bestiary of nihilists, destructionists and even criminals.

item.title: Metula, Israeli Town on Lebanon Border, Worries for Its Future
item.description: Abandoned and off limits to civilians, Metula, a symbol of early pioneering Zionism, is left half-ruined by Hezbollah’s rockets and missiles.

item.title: Ex-Obama aide explains why Kamala Harris is losing Gen Z men to Donald Trump
item.description: Harris isn’t meeting young male voters where they are—or where they get their news: “This is what Trump is doing every day.”

item.title: Goldman Sachs-backed Simbe raises $50M in Series C funding to bolster retail robot business
item.description: Simbe is now working with 29 retail brands.

item.title: Short on Time, Harris’s Labor Allies Sprint to Reach Working-Class Voters
item.description: Unions and their affiliates think they can still break through with the Democrats’ worst demographic, white working-class voters, by hustling on the g...

item.title: E.P.A. Toughens Requirements to Remove Lead Paint Dust Around Children
item.description: The new rules consider any detectable level of lead dust in a building a “lead hazard,” requiring property owners to pay for cleanup.

item.title: Unilever sales growth accelerates under CEO’s overhaul plan
item.description: Revenue increased 4.5% in the third quarter, beating the 4.3% expected by analysts, the maker of soap and stock cubes said Thursday.

item.title: Elon Musk Plots His Final Moves for Trump
item.description: With less than two weeks until Election Day, the richest person in the world is throwing himself into the effort to elect the former president.

item.title: There Are Four Anti-Trump Pathways We Failed to Take. There Is a Fifth.
item.description: Why have so many of our democracy’s defenses seemingly broken down, and which, if any, remain?

item.title: Blinken Pursues Regional Tour as Mideast Conflict Deepens
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken sought to ease tensions on a visit to Israel, followed by a meeting with the Saudi crown prince in Riyadh. Israel...
